member.name: T:Kimola.Api.PresetsClient
member.summary: Provides methods for interacting with the Kimola API's Presets endpoints.
member.remarks: This client allows you to retrieve preset definitions, fetch their associated labels, and run text predictions using a specific preset. It handles all HTTP communication, serialization, and error handling.
member.param: The instance used to send HTTP requests to the Kimola API. This should be configured with the base URL and any required authentication headers.
The used to control JSON serialization and deserialization for requests and responses.

member.name: M:Kimola.Api.PresetsClient.#ctor(System.Net.Http.HttpClient,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions)
member.summary: Provides methods for interacting with the Kimola API's Presets endpoints.
member.remarks: This client allows you to retrieve preset definitions, fetch their associated labels, and run text predictions using a specific preset. It handles all HTTP communication, serialization, and error handling.
member.param: The instance used to send HTTP requests to the Kimola API. This should be configured with the base URL and any required authentication headers.
The used to control JSON serialization and deserialization for requests and responses.

member.name: M:Kimola.Api.PresetsClient.GetAsync(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Retrieves a paginated list of presets from the Kimola API, optionally filtered by type and category.
member.param: The number of presets to include in each page. Defaults to 10.
The zero-based index of the page to retrieve. Defaults to 0.
Optional filter to retrieve presets of a specific type.
Optional filter to retrieve presets within a specific category.
A cancellation token that can be used to cancel the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation. The task result contains a with the retrieved presets and pagination metadata.
member.exception: Thrown when the API responds with a non-success status code.

member.name: M:Kimola.Api.PresetsClient.GetByKeyAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Retrieves a specific preset from the Kimola API by its unique key.
member.param: The unique identifier of the preset to retrieve. Must be a valid, non-empty string with a minimum length of 8 characters.
A cancellation token that can be used to cancel the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the object corresponding to the specified key.
member.exception: Thrown when the provided is null, empty, or shorter than 8 characters.
Thrown when the API responds with a non-success status code.

member.name: M:Kimola.Api.PresetsClient.GetLabelsAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Retrieves the list of labels associated with a specific preset from the Kimola API.
member.param: The unique identifier of the preset whose labels are to be retrieved. Must be a valid, non-empty string with a minimum length of 8 characters.
A cancellation token that can be used to cancel the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation. The task result contains a read-only list of objects, or null if no labels are found.
member.exception: Thrown when the provided is null, empty, or shorter than 8 characters.
Thrown when the API responds with a non-success status code.

member.name: M:Kimola.Api.PresetsClient.PredictAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Sends text to a specified preset for prediction and retrieves the analysis results.
member.param: The unique identifier of the preset to use for prediction. Must be a valid, non-empty string with a minimum length of 8 characters.
The input text to analyze. This field is required and cannot be null or empty.
Optional ISO language code (e.g., "en", "tr"). When provided, the preset will process the text using the specified language.
A flag indicating whether aspect-based analysis should be performed. Set to true for detailed aspect-level predictions; defaults to false.
A cancellation token that can be used to cancel the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation. The task result contains a read-only list of objects representing the prediction outcomes.
member.exception: Thrown when the is invalid or when the parameter is null or empty.
Thrown when the API responds with a non-success status code.

member.name: M:Kimola.Api.PresetsClient.Send``1(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod,System.String,System.Net.Http.HttpContent,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Sends an HTTP request to the Kimola API and deserializes the response content to the specified type.
member.typeparam: The type to which the response body will be deserialized.
member.param: The HTTP method to use for the request, such as GET, POST, PUT, or DELETE.
The relative URL path for the API endpoint, including query parameters if applicable.
The optional HTTP content to include in the request body, such as JSON payload for POST or PUT requests. Pass null for requests without a body.
A cancellation token that can be used to cancel the request.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the deserialized response of type .
member.exception: Thrown when the API returns a non-success HTTP status code, providing details of the error response.
Thrown when the response body is empty or cannot be deserialized into the specified type .

member.name: M:Kimola.Api.PresetsClient.EnsureKey(System.String)
member.summary: Validates that the provided preset key is not null, empty, or shorter than the required length.
member.param: The preset key to validate. Must be a non-empty string with a minimum length of 8 characters.
member.exception: Thrown when the is null, empty, or shorter than 8 characters.

member.name: M:Kimola.Api.QueriesClient.GetAsync(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset},System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Retrieves a paginated list of query items from the Kimola API, optionally filtered by date range.
member.param: The zero-based index of the page to retrieve. Defaults to 0.
The number of items to include in each page. Defaults to 10.
Optional start date (UTC). When provided, only queries created on or after this date will be included.
Optional end date (UTC). When provided, only queries created on or before this date will be included.
A cancellation token that can be used to cancel the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains a read-only list of objects.

member.name: M:Kimola.Api.QueriesClient.GetStatisticsAsync(System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset},System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Retrieves aggregated query statistics from the Kimola API, optionally filtered by a date range.
member.param: Optional start date (UTC). When provided, only statistics for queries created on or after this date will be included.
Optional end date (UTC). When provided, only statistics for queries created on or before this date will be included.
A cancellation token that can be used to cancel the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains a read-only list of objects representing aggregated statistics about the queries.

A cancellation token that can be used to cancel the asynchronous operation.

member.name: T:Kimola.Api.SubscriptionClient
member.summary: Provides methods for interacting with the subscription-related endpoints of the Kimola API.
member.remarks: This client allows you to retrieve subscription information such as resource usage and quotas. It manages the HTTP communication, serialization, and error handling internally.
member.param: The instance used to send HTTP requests to the Kimola API. It should be configured with the base address and any necessary authentication headers.
The used to configure JSON serialization and deserialization when processing API requests and responses.

member.name: T:Kimola.Api.KimolaHttpException
member.summary: Represents errors returned from the Kimola API when an HTTP request fails.
member.remarks: This exception includes the HTTP status code and the raw response body for easier debugging. It is thrown whenever the API returns a non-success status code (4xx or 5xx).

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.KimolaHttpException.StatusCode
member.summary: The HTTP status code returned by the API.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.KimolaHttpException.ResponseBody
member.summary: The raw body of the HTTP response, if available.

member.name: M:Kimola.Api.KimolaHttpException.#ctor(System.Net.HttpStatusCode,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The HTTP status code returned by the API.
The raw HTTP response body returned by the API, if available.
A user-friendly error message describing the issue.

member.name: M:Kimola.Api.KimolaHttpException.FromResponse(System.Net.HttpStatusCode,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new based on the provided status code and response body.
member.param: The HTTP status code returned by the API.
The raw response body returned by the API.
member.returns: A with a descriptive error message.
member.remarks:
Custom messages are provided for common API errors:
400 – Bad Request: Missing or invalid Authorization header.
401 – Unauthorized: Invalid API key.
403 – Forbidden: API key does not have permission to access this resource.
For all other status codes, a generic message will be generated.

member.name: T:Kimola.Api.HttpReadHelpers
member.summary: Helper methods for safely reading HTTP responses.

member.name: M:Kimola.Api.HttpReadHelpers.SafeReadAsync(System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage)
member.summary: Safely reads the response body from an as a string. If reading fails, returns null instead of throwing an exception.
member.param: The HTTP response message to read.
member.returns: The response body as a string, or null if reading fails.

member.name: T:Kimola.Api.KimolaClientOptions
member.summary: Provides configuration options for initializing a instance.
member.remarks: This class contains settings such as the API key, base URL, and a custom .

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.KimolaClientOptions.ApiKey
member.summary: The API key used to authenticate requests to the Kimola API.
member.remarks: This property is required. Requests will fail if a valid API key is not provided.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.KimolaClientOptions.BaseUrl
member.summary: The base URL of the Kimola API. Defaults to https://api.kimola.com/v1.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.KimolaClientOptions.HttpClient
member.summary: An optional custom instance to use for sending requests.
member.remarks: If this is not provided, a new will be created and managed internally.

member.name: T:Kimola.Api.KimolaClient
member.summary: Entry point for interacting with the Kimola API using a shared .
member.remarks:
This client configures Bearer authentication (Authorization: Bearer <apiKey>) and JSON serialization, and exposes typed resource clients:
— catalog of pretrained models (list, get by key, labels, predictions).
— query-consumption history and aggregated statistics (UTC date range, pagination).
— current or historical subscription usage (links, models, queries, keywords).
Dates are treated as UTC (ISO-8601 ...Z). Pagination defaults to pageIndex=0, pageSize=10 (capped at 10) where applicable.

member.name: F:Kimola.Api.KimolaClient.Json
member.summary: The JSON serializer options used across resource clients (web defaults, case-insensitive, ignore nulls).

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.KimolaClient.Presets
member.summary: Operations for Kimola Presets (pretrained AI models): list, get by key, fetch labels, and run predictions (standard or aspect-based).
member.remarks: For predictions, the API accepts a raw JSON string as the request body ("text" content), optional language (ISO-639-1), and aspectBased mode. Aspect-based predictions return per-aspect sentiments; standard predictions return a dominant label with probability.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.KimolaClient.Queries
member.summary: Operations for inspecting Query consumption: paginated activity and aggregated statistics by category (e.g., Classification, Tracking, Scraping). Supports optional UTC date filtering.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.KimolaClient.Subscription
member.summary: Operations for retrieving subscription usage (counts, limits, remaining, percentages) for resources such as Links, Models, Queries, and Keywords. Supports an optional UTC date to access past periods.

member.name: M:Kimola.Api.KimolaClient.#ctor(Kimola.Api.KimolaClientOptions)
member.summary: Initializes a new with the provided options (API key, base URL, optional ).
member.exception: Thrown when is null, empty, or whitespace.

member.name: M:Kimola.Api.KimolaClient.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the underlying instance if it is owned by this class.

member.name: M:Kimola.Api.KimolaClient.AppendSlash(System.String)
member.summary: Ensures the configured base URL ends with a trailing slash to form valid relative request URIs.
member.param: The base URL.
member.returns: The base URL with a trailing slash.

member.name: T:Kimola.Api.PredictionResult
member.summary: Represents the result of a prediction returned by the Kimola API.
member.remarks:
For **standard predictions** (aspectBased=false): - The property will be populated with a confidence score between 0.0 and 1.0. - The property will be null.
For **aspect-based predictions** (aspectBased=true): - The property will indicate the detected sentiment, such as "Positive", "Negative", or "Neutral". - The property will be null.
member.param: The name or label associated with the prediction, such as a category or aspect.
The confidence score for standard predictions. Only populated when aspectBased=false; otherwise, this is null.
The sentiment result for aspect-based predictions. Only populated when aspectBased=true; otherwise, this is null.

member.name: M:Kimola.Api.PredictionResult.#ctor(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Double},System.String)
member.summary: Represents the result of a prediction returned by the Kimola API.
member.remarks:
For **standard predictions** (aspectBased=false): - The property will be populated with a confidence score between 0.0 and 1.0. - The property will be null.
For **aspect-based predictions** (aspectBased=true): - The property will indicate the detected sentiment, such as "Positive", "Negative", or "Neutral". - The property will be null.
member.param: The name or label associated with the prediction, such as a category or aspect.
The confidence score for standard predictions. Only populated when aspectBased=false; otherwise, this is null.
The sentiment result for aspect-based predictions. Only populated when aspectBased=true; otherwise, this is null.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.PredictionResult.Name
member.summary: The name or label associated with the prediction, such as a category or aspect.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.PredictionResult.Probability
member.summary: The confidence score for standard predictions. Only populated when aspectBased=false; otherwise, this is null.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.PredictionResult.Sentiment
member.summary: The sentiment result for aspect-based predictions. Only populated when aspectBased=true; otherwise, this is null.

member.name: T:Kimola.Api.Preset
member.summary: Represents a **preset definition** in the Kimola API.
member.remarks: A preset is a ready-to-use AI model hosted by Kimola that performs tasks such as text classification or entity extraction. You can retrieve a list of presets using GET /presets and run predictions with POST /presets/{key}/predictions.
member.param: The unique identifier of the preset (24-character string). This is required when requesting labels or predictions.
A URL-friendly string representing the preset name or category.
The display name of the preset, used in UI and dashboards.

member.name: M:Kimola.Api.Preset.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Represents a **preset definition** in the Kimola API.
member.remarks: A preset is a ready-to-use AI model hosted by Kimola that performs tasks such as text classification or entity extraction. You can retrieve a list of presets using GET /presets and run predictions with POST /presets/{key}/predictions.
member.param: The unique identifier of the preset (24-character string). This is required when requesting labels or predictions.
A URL-friendly string representing the preset name or category.
The display name of the preset, used in UI and dashboards.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.Preset.Key
member.summary: The unique identifier of the preset (24-character string). This is required when requesting labels or predictions.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.Preset.Slug
member.summary: A URL-friendly string representing the preset name or category.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.Preset.Name
member.summary: The display name of the preset, used in UI and dashboards.

member.name: T:Kimola.Api.PagedPresetsResponse
member.summary: Represents a paginated API response containing a collection of presets.
member.remarks: Returned by GET /presets when listing available pretrained models. Includes the total count for pagination and the current page of results.
member.param: The total number of presets available that match the current query filters.
A read-only list of objects representing the current page of results.

member.name: M:Kimola.Api.PagedPresetsResponse.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{Kimola.Api.Preset})
member.summary: Represents a paginated API response containing a collection of presets.
member.remarks: Returned by GET /presets when listing available pretrained models. Includes the total count for pagination and the current page of results.
member.param: The total number of presets available that match the current query filters.
A read-only list of objects representing the current page of results.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.PagedPresetsResponse.Total
member.summary: The total number of presets available that match the current query filters.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.PagedPresetsResponse.Items
member.summary: A read-only list of objects representing the current page of results.

member.name: T:Kimola.Api.PresetLabel
member.summary: Represents a label associated with a specific preset in the Kimola API.
member.remarks: Labels define the possible outputs for a classification model. Use GET /presets/{key}/labels to retrieve these for a given preset.
member.param: The label name, such as Positive, Negative, or another category.
An optional description providing more context about the label, such as its use case or meaning.

member.name: M:Kimola.Api.PresetLabel.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Represents a label associated with a specific preset in the Kimola API.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.PresetLabel.Description
member.summary: An optional description providing more context about the label, such as its use case or meaning.

member.name: T:Kimola.Api.QueryReport
member.summary: Represents the report details included in a query entry.
member.remarks: Each query is linked to a report that triggered the consumption. This contains identifying information about the report, which is useful for tracking where the queries originated.
member.param: The unique identifier (GUID) of the report.
The internal name of the report.
The user-friendly title of the report displayed in the dashboard or UI.

member.summary: The internal name of the report.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.QueryReport.Title
member.summary: The user-friendly title of the report displayed in the dashboard or UI.

member.name: T:Kimola.Api.QueryItemRecord
member.summary: Represents the specific item within a query transaction.
member.remarks: A query item describes what entity was involved in the query, such as a preset or another resource. This helps categorize and understand what type of action consumed queries.
member.param: The unique identifier (GUID) of the item.
The display name of the item.
The type of the query item (e.g., Classifier, Scraper, Tracker).

member.summary: Represents the specific item within a query transaction.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.QueryItemRecord.Name
member.summary: The display name of the item.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.QueryItemRecord.Type
member.summary: The type of the query item (e.g., Classifier, Scraper, Tracker).

member.name: T:Kimola.Api.QueryItem
member.summary: Represents a single query consumption event.
member.remarks: Each entry shows the report and item involved, along with metadata such as the amount consumed and the timestamp. Use this model to inspect consumption history when calling GET /queries.
member.param: The report associated with this query event.
The specific query item linked to this event.
The classification of the query event, such as Classification, Tracking, or Scraping.
The number of queries consumed by this event.
The timestamp (UTC) indicating when the query was processed. Serialized in ISO 8601 format with a Z suffix.

member.name: M:Kimola.Api.QueryItem.#ctor(Kimola.Api.QueryReport,Kimola.Api.QueryItemRecord,System.String,System.Int32,System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary: Represents a single query consumption event.
member.remarks: Each entry shows the report and item involved, along with metadata such as the amount consumed and the timestamp. Use this model to inspect consumption history when calling GET /queries.
member.param: The report associated with this query event.
The specific query item linked to this event.
The classification of the query event, such as Classification, Tracking, or Scraping.
The number of queries consumed by this event.
The timestamp (UTC) indicating when the query was processed. Serialized in ISO 8601 format with a Z suffix.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.QueryItem.Report
member.summary: The report associated with this query event.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.QueryItem.Item
member.summary: The specific query item linked to this event.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.QueryItem.Type
member.summary: The classification of the query event, such as Classification, Tracking, or Scraping.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.QueryItem.Amount
member.summary: The number of queries consumed by this event.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.QueryItem.Date
member.summary: The timestamp (UTC) indicating when the query was processed. Serialized in ISO 8601 format with a Z suffix.

member.name: T:Kimola.Api.QueryStat
member.summary: Represents aggregated query usage statistics for a given category.
member.remarks: This is returned by the GET /queries/statistics endpoint to show grouped consumption by category.
member.param: The category name, such as Classification, Tracking, or Scraping.
The total number of queries consumed for this category.
The ratio of this category relative to total consumption (e.g., 0.73 for 73%).
The ratio expressed as a whole number percentage (e.g., 73).

member.name: M:Kimola.Api.QueryStat.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Represents aggregated query usage statistics for a given category.
member.remarks: This is returned by the GET /queries/statistics endpoint to show grouped consumption by category.
member.param: The category name, such as Classification, Tracking, or Scraping.
The total number of queries consumed for this category.
The ratio of this category relative to total consumption (e.g., 0.73 for 73%).
The ratio expressed as a whole number percentage (e.g., 73).

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.QueryStat.Name
member.summary: The category name, such as Classification, Tracking, or Scraping.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.QueryStat.Count
member.summary: The total number of queries consumed for this category.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.QueryStat.Ratio
member.summary: The ratio of this category relative to total consumption (e.g., 0.73 for 73%).

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.QueryStat.Percentage
member.summary: The ratio expressed as a whole number percentage (e.g., 73).

member.name: T:Kimola.Api.SubscriptionUsageBucket
member.summary: Represents a single usage bucket within a subscription plan. Each bucket corresponds to a specific resource type tracked by Kimola, such as links, models, queries, or keywords.
member.param: The number of units that have been consumed for this resource type in the current or specified billing period.
The maximum number of units allowed for this resource type under the current subscription plan.
The percentage of the limit that has been used, ranging from 0.0 to 100.0.
The number of remaining units before this resource type reaches its limit.

member.name: M:Kimola.Api.SubscriptionUsageBucket.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Represents a single usage bucket within a subscription plan. Each bucket corresponds to a specific resource type tracked by Kimola, such as links, models, queries, or keywords.
member.param: The number of units that have been consumed for this resource type in the current or specified billing period.
The maximum number of units allowed for this resource type under the current subscription plan.
The percentage of the limit that has been used, ranging from 0.0 to 100.0.
The number of remaining units before this resource type reaches its limit.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.SubscriptionUsageBucket.Count
member.summary: The number of units that have been consumed for this resource type in the current or specified billing period.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.SubscriptionUsageBucket.Limit
member.summary: The maximum number of units allowed for this resource type under the current subscription plan.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.SubscriptionUsageBucket.Percentage
member.summary: The percentage of the limit that has been used, ranging from 0.0 to 100.0.

member.name: P:Kimola.Api.SubscriptionUsageBucket.Available
member.summary: The number of remaining units before this resource type reaches its limit.

member.name: T:Kimola.Api.SubscriptionUsage
member.summary: Represents the overall subscription usage for the current or a past billing period. Provides usage details for each tracked resource type: Links, Models, Queries, and Keywords.
member.param: Usage information for link-based resources. These represent API actions related to link tracking within the Kimola platform.
Usage information for model-based resources. These represent API actions related to machine learning models, such as running predictions or classifications.
Usage information for query-based resources. This includes all transactions like classification, scraping, and tracking customer feedback. Serialized as "query" in the API response.
Usage information for keyword-based resources. These represent resources related to keyword tracking or analysis within the Kimola platform.

member.name: M:Kimola.Api.SubscriptionUsage.#ctor(Kimola.Api.SubscriptionUsageBucket,Kimola.Api.SubscriptionUsageBucket,Kimola.Api.SubscriptionUsageBucket,Kimola.Api.SubscriptionUsageBucket)
